8 MONTH WORK TERM

Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 8 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

LOCATION IS NOT IN VICTORIA
It is recommended that you speak to your ability to relocate for this position in your cover letter. If you are taking courses in / are from the job location, it is recommended that you mention this in your cover letter. Please do not apply for this position if you are not willing to relocate for the duration of the work term without expectation of remuneration.

NEED HELP TO RELOCATE?

If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria

Apera AI is seeking a talented co-op student to join our team as a Software Development Engineer. You will work closely with a small group of ambitious engineers and applied scientists who are dedicated to building the future of robotic perception using cutting-edge technologies in computer vision and machine learning.

Your job will include:

Working with our engineers on developing the next generation robot calibration algorithms
Working closely with our software engineering team in an Agile environment
Developing with Qt to add new features to the Apera VUE UI
Adding or improving features to the Apera VUE backend, written in C++
Testing and improving of Apera's camera and robot calibration routines and algorithms
Contributing to general software activities, such as participating in code review
Creating robot programs showing upcoming Apera Vue features
Experimenting with different hardware combinations to confirm system design parameters
Contributing to the general software development activities

About Apera AI:
Apera AI helps manufacturers make their factories more flexible and productive. Robots enhanced with Vue robotic vision software have 4D Vision-the ability to see and handle objects with human-like capability. Challenging applications such as bin picking, sorting, packaging, and assembly are now open to fast, precise and reliable automation. Apera AI is led by an experienced team from high-growth companies focused on robotics, artificial intelligence, and advanced manufacturing.

About you:
We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic, driven, and eager to learn. You have a natural curiosity for problem-solving and a passion for applying scientific principles to real-world challenges. You thrive in a dynamic environment and are excited about the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to our company.

Job Requirements:

Strong programming skills (data structures, algorithms, OO)
Strong linear algebra fundamentals
C++ development experience

Desirable qualifications:

Experience with working in Linux environment
Familiarity with computer vision algorithms (classical and ML)
Experience with software debugging tools and technique
Familiarity with digital imaging and optics
